-- | <a>ChapInfo</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ciInitiatorName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciSecretToAuthenticateInitiator</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciSecretToAuthenticateTarget</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ciTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
chapInfo :: ChapInfo

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
ciInitiatorName :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the initiator (e.g. Windows client) must provide
--   to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
ciSecretToAuthenticateInitiator :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g. Windows client).
ciSecretToAuthenticateTarget :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: 50 to 500 lowercase letters, numbers, periods
--   (.), and hyphens (-).
ciTargetARN :: Lens' ChapInfo (Maybe Text)

taCompletionTime :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe UTCTime)

--   tape is being retrieved to.
--   
--   The virtual tape is retrieved from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).

taTapeStatus :: Lens' TapeArchive (Maybe Text)

-- | This operation updates the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. You can
--   update both the upload and download bandwidth rate limit or specify
--   only one of the two. If you don't set a bandwidth rate limit, the
--   existing rate limit remains.
--   
--   By default, a gateway's bandwidth rate limits are not set. If you
--   don't set any limit, the gateway does not have any limitations on its
--   bandwidth usage and could potentially use the maximum available
--   bandwidth.
--   
--   To specify which gateway to update, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway in your request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateBandwidthRateLimit.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
data UpdateBandwidthRateLimit

-- | <a>UpdateBandwidthRateLimit</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ubrlAverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ubrlAverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ubrlGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateBandwidthRateLimit :: Text -> UpdateBandwidthRateLimit

-- | The average download bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
ubrlAverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimit (Maybe Natural)

-- | The average upload bandwidth rate limit in bits per second.
ubrlAverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimit (Maybe Natural)
ubrlGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimit Text
data UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse

-- | <a>UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ubrlrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateBandwidthRateLimitResponse :: UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
ubrlrGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance Ord UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance Read UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance Show UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance Eq UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Ord UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Read UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Show UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Monoid UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance FromJSON UpdateBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance ToJSON UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance ToHeaders UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance ToQuery UpdateBandwidthRateLimit
instance ToPath UpdateBandwidthRateLimit


-- | This operation updates the Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol
--   (CHAP) credentials for a specified iSCSI target. By default, a gateway
--   does not have CHAP enabled; however, for added security, you might use
--   it.
--   
--   When you update CHAP credentials, all existing connections on the
--   target are closed and initiators must reconnect with the new
--   credentials.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateChapCredentials.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateChapCredentials
data UpdateChapCredentials

-- | <a>UpdateChapCredentials</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uccInitiatorName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uccSecretToAuthenticateInitiator</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uccSecretToAuthenticateTarget</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uccTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateChapCredentials :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateChapCredentials

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
uccInitiatorName :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentials Text

-- | The secret key that the initiator (e.g. Windows client) must provide
--   to participate in mutual CHAP with the target.
uccSecretToAuthenticateInitiator :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentials Text

-- | The secret key that the target must provide to participate in mutual
--   CHAP with the initiator (e.g. Windows client).
uccSecretToAuthenticateTarget :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentials (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   <tt>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</tt> operation to return to retrieve
--   the TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
uccTargetARN :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentials Text
data UpdateChapCredentialsResponse

-- | <a>UpdateChapCredentialsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uccrInitiatorName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uccrTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateChapCredentialsResponse :: UpdateChapCredentialsResponse

-- | The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target. This is the same
--   initiator name specified in the request.
uccrInitiatorName :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentialsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target. This is the same target
--   specified in the request.
uccrTargetARN :: Lens' UpdateChapCredentialsResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq UpdateChapCredentials
instance Ord UpdateChapCredentials
instance Read UpdateChapCredentials
instance Show UpdateChapCredentials
instance Eq UpdateChapCredentialsResponse
instance Ord UpdateChapCredentialsResponse
instance Read UpdateChapCredentialsResponse
instance Show UpdateChapCredentialsResponse
instance FromJSON UpdateChapCredentialsResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateChapCredentials
instance ToJSON UpdateChapCredentials
instance ToHeaders UpdateChapCredentials
instance ToQuery UpdateChapCredentials
instance ToPath UpdateChapCredentials

--

--   </ul>
updateGatewayInformationResponse :: UpdateGatewayInformationResponse

-- | This operation updates the gateway virtual machine (VM) software. The
--   request immediately triggers the software update.
--   
--   When you make this request, you get a '200 OK' success response
--   immediately. However, it might take some time for the update to
--   complete. You can call <tt>DescribeGatewayInformation</tt> to verify
--   the gateway is in the <tt>STATE_RUNNING</tt> state. A software update
--   forces a system restart of your gateway. You can minimize the chance
--   of any disruption to your applications by increasing your iSCSI
--   Initiators' timeouts. For more information about increasing iSCSI
--   Initiator timeouts for Windows and Linux, see <a>Customizing Your
--   Windows iSCSI Settings</a> and <a>Customizing Your Linux iSCSI
--   Settings</a>, respectively.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
data UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow

-- | <a>UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ugsnGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateGatewaySoftwareNow :: Text -> UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
ugsnGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow Text
data UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse

-- | <a>UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ugsnrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse :: UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
ugsnrGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance Ord UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance Read UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance Show UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance Monoid UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance IsString UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance Eq UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
instance Ord UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
instance Read UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
instance Show UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
instance Monoid UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse
instance FromJSON UpdateGatewaySoftwareNowResponse

instance ToJSON UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance ToHeaders UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow
instance ToQuery UpdateGatewaySoftwareNow

-- | This operation updates a gateway's weekly maintenance start time
--   information, including day and time of the week. The maintenance time
--   is the time in your gateway's time zone.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateMaintenanceStartTime.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
data UpdateMaintenanceStartTime

-- | <a>UpdateMaintenanceStartTime</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>umstDayOfWeek</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>umstGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>umstHourOfDay</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>umstMinuteOfHour</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateMaintenanceStartTime :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> UpdateMaintenanceStartTime

-- | The maintenance start time day of the week.
umstDayOfWeek :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Natural
umstGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Text

-- | The hour component of the maintenance start time represented as hh,
--   where <i>hh</i> is the hour (00 to 23). The hour of the day is in the
--   time zone of the gateway.
umstHourOfDay :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Natural

-- | The minute component of the maintenance start time represented as
--   <i>mm</i>, where <i>mm</i> is the minute (00 to 59). The minute of the
--   hour is in the time zone of the gateway.
umstMinuteOfHour :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTime Natural

-- | <a>UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse</a> constructor.

--

--   <li><a>umstrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse :: UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse
umstrGatewayARN :: Lens' UpdateMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
instance Ord UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
instance Read UpdateMaintenanceStartTime
instance Show UpdateMaintenanceStartTime

-- | This operation updates a snapshot schedule configured for a gateway
--   volume.
--   
--   The default snapshot schedule for volume is once every 24 hours,
--   starting at the creation time of the volume. You can use this API to
--   change the snapshot schedule configured for the volume.
--   
--   In the request you must identify the gateway volume whose snapshot
--   schedule you want to update, and the schedule information, including
--   when you want the snapshot to begin on a day and the frequency (in
--   hours) of snapshots.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateSnapshotSchedule.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateSnapshotSchedule
data UpdateSnapshotSchedule

-- | <a>UpdateSnapshotSchedule</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ussDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ussRecurrenceInHours</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ussStartAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ussVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateSnapshotSchedule :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> UpdateSnapshotSchedule

-- | Optional description of the snapshot that overwrites the existing
--   description.
ussDescription :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule (Maybe Text)

-- | Frequency of snapshots. Specify the number of hours between snapshots.
ussRecurrenceInHours :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Natural

-- | The hour of the day at which the snapshot schedule begins represented
--   as <i>hh</i>, where <i>hh</i> is the hour (0 to 23). The hour of the
--   day is in the time zone of the gateway.
ussStartAt :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Natural

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the
--   <tt>ListVolumes</tt> operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
ussVolumeARN :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotSchedule Text
data UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse

-- | <a>UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ussrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateSnapshotScheduleResponse :: UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
ussrVolumeARN :: Lens' UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance Ord UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance Read UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance Show UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance Eq UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Ord UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Read UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Show UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Monoid UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance FromJSON UpdateSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance AWSRequest UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance ToJSON UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance ToHeaders UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance ToQuery UpdateSnapshotSchedule
instance ToPath UpdateSnapshotSchedule


-- | This operation updates the type of medium changer in a gateway-VTL.
--   When you activate a gateway-VTL, you select a medium changer type for
--   the gateway-VTL. This operation enables you to select a different type
--   of medium changer after a gateway-VTL is activated.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateVTLDeviceType.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.UpdateVTLDeviceType
data UpdateVTLDeviceType

-- | <a>UpdateVTLDeviceType</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>uvtldtDeviceType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>uvtldtVTLDeviceARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
updateVTLDeviceType :: Text -> Text -> UpdateVTLDeviceType

-- | The type of medium changer you want to select.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: <a>STK-L700</a>, <a>AWS-Gateway-VTL</a>
uvtldtDeviceType :: Lens' UpdateVTLDeviceType Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the medium changer you want to
--   select.
uvtldtVTLDeviceARN :: Lens' UpdateVTLDeviceType Text

updateVTLDeviceTypeResponse :: UpdateVTLDeviceTypeResponse

--   selected.
uvtldtrVTLDeviceARN :: Lens' UpdateVTLDeviceTypeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This operation starts a gateway that you previously shut down (see
--   <tt>ShutdownGateway</tt>). After the gateway starts, you can then make
--   other API calls, your applications can read from or write to the
--   gateway's storage volumes and you will be able to take snapshot
--   backups.
--   
--   When you make a request, you will get a 200 OK success response
--   immediately. However, it might take some time for the gateway to be
--   ready. You should call <tt>DescribeGatewayInformation</tt> and check
--   the status before making any additional API calls. For more
--   information, see <tt>ActivateGateway</tt>. To specify which gateway to
--   start, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your
--   request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_StartGateway.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.StartGateway
data StartGateway

-- | <a>StartGateway</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sgGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
startGateway :: Text -> StartGateway
sgGatewayARN :: Lens' StartGateway Text
data StartGatewayResponse

-- | <a>StartGatewayResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sgrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
startGatewayResponse :: StartGatewayResponse
sgrGatewayARN :: Lens' StartGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq StartGateway
instance Ord StartGateway
instance Read StartGateway
instance Show StartGateway
instance Monoid StartGateway
instance IsString StartGateway
instance Eq StartGatewayResponse
instance Ord StartGatewayResponse
instance Read StartGatewayResponse
instance Show StartGatewayResponse
instance Monoid StartGatewayResponse
instance FromJSON StartGatewayResponse
instance AWSRequest StartGateway
instance ToJSON StartGateway
instance ToHeaders StartGateway
instance ToQuery StartGateway
instance ToPath StartGateway


-- | This operation shuts down a gateway. To specify which gateway to shut
--   down, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in the body of
--   your request.
--   
--   The operation shuts down the gateway service component running in the
--   storage gateway's virtual machine (VM) and not the VM.
--   
--   If you want to shut down the VM, it is recommended that you first shut
--   down the gateway component in the VM to avoid unpredictable
--   conditions. After the gateway is shutdown, you cannot call any other
--   API except <tt>StartGateway</tt>, <tt>DescribeGatewayInformation</tt>,
--   and <tt>ListGateways</tt>. For more information, see
--   <tt>ActivateGateway</tt>. Your applications cannot read from or write
--   to the gateway's storage volumes, and there are no snapshots taken.
--   
--   When you make a shutdown request, you will get a '200 OK' success
--   response immediately. However, it might take some time for the gateway
--   to shut down. You can call the <tt>DescribeGatewayInformation</tt> API
--   to check the status. For more information, see
--   <tt>ActivateGateway</tt>. If do not intend to use the gateway again,
--   you must delete the gateway (using <tt>DeleteGateway</tt>) to no
--   longer pay software charges associated with the gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ShutdownGateway.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ShutdownGateway
data ShutdownGateway

-- | <a>ShutdownGateway</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sg1GatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
shutdownGateway :: Text -> ShutdownGateway
sg1GatewayARN :: Lens' ShutdownGateway Text
data ShutdownGatewayResponse

-- | <a>ShutdownGatewayResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>sgr1GatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
shutdownGatewayResponse :: ShutdownGatewayResponse
sgr1GatewayARN :: Lens' ShutdownGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ShutdownGateway
instance Ord ShutdownGateway
instance Read ShutdownGateway
instance Show ShutdownGateway
instance Monoid ShutdownGateway
instance IsString ShutdownGateway
instance Eq ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance Ord ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance Read ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance Show ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance Monoid ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance FromJSON ShutdownGatewayResponse
instance AWSRequest ShutdownGateway
instance ToJSON ShutdownGateway
instance ToHeaders ShutdownGateway
instance ToQuery ShutdownGateway
instance ToPath ShutdownGateway


-- | Retrieves the recovery point for the specified virtual tape.
--   
--   A recovery point is a point in time view of a virtual tape at which
--   all the data on the tape is consistent. If your gateway crashes,
--   virtual tapes that have recovery points can be recovered to a new
--   gateway.
--   
--   The virtual tape can be retrieved to only one gateway. The retrieved
--   tape is read-only. The virtual tape can be retrieved to only a
--   gateway-VTL. There is no charge for retrieving recovery points.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
data RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint

-- | <a>RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtrpGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rtrpTapeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
retrieveTapeRecoveryPoint :: Text -> Text -> RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
rtrpGatewayARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape for which you want
--   to retrieve the recovery point.
rtrpTapeARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint Text
data RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse

-- | <a>RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtrprTapeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
retrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse :: RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape for which the
--   recovery point was retrieved.
rtrprTapeARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance Ord RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance Read RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance Show RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance Eq RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Ord RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Read RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Show RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Monoid RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance FromJSON RetrieveTapeRecoveryPointResponse
instance AWSRequest RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance ToJSON RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance ToHeaders RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance ToQuery RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint
instance ToPath RetrieveTapeRecoveryPoint


-- | Retrieves an archived virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS)
--   to a gateway-VTL. Virtual tapes archived in the VTS are not associated
--   with any gateway. However after a tape is retrieved, it is associated
--   with a gateway, even though it is also listed in the VTS.
--   
--   Once a tape is successfully retrieved to a gateway, it cannot be
--   retrieved again to another gateway. You must archive the tape again
--   before you can retrieve it to another gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_RetrieveTapeArchive.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.RetrieveTapeArchive
data RetrieveTapeArchive

-- | <a>RetrieveTapeArchive</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtaGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>rtaTapeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
retrieveTapeArchive :: Text -> Text -> RetrieveTapeArchive

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway you want to retrieve the
--   virtual tape to. Use the <tt>ListGateways</tt> operation to return a
--   list of gateways for your account and region.
--   
--   You retrieve archived virtual tapes to only one gateway and the
--   gateway must be a gateway-VTL.
rtaGatewayARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeArchive Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to
--   retrieve from the virtual tape shelf (VTS).
rtaTapeARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeArchive Text
data RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse

-- | <a>RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rtarTapeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
retrieveTapeArchiveResponse :: RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the retrieved virtual tape.
rtarTapeARN :: Lens' RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq RetrieveTapeArchive
instance Ord RetrieveTapeArchive
instance Read RetrieveTapeArchive
instance Show RetrieveTapeArchive
instance Eq RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance Ord RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance Read RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance Show RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance Monoid RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance FromJSON RetrieveTapeArchiveResponse
instance AWSRequest RetrieveTapeArchive
instance ToJSON RetrieveTapeArchive
instance ToHeaders RetrieveTapeArchive
instance ToQuery RetrieveTapeArchive
instance ToPath RetrieveTapeArchive


-- | This operation resets all cache disks and makes the disks available
--   for reconfiguration as cache storage. When a cache is reset, the
--   gateway loses its cache storage. At this point you can reconfigure the
--   disks as cache disks.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ResetCache.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ResetCache
data ResetCache

-- | <a>ResetCache</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
resetCache :: Text -> ResetCache
rcGatewayARN :: Lens' ResetCache Text
data ResetCacheResponse

-- | <a>ResetCacheResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>rcrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
resetCacheResponse :: ResetCacheResponse
rcrGatewayARN :: Lens' ResetCacheResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ResetCache
instance Ord ResetCache
instance Read ResetCache
instance Show ResetCache
instance Monoid ResetCache
instance IsString ResetCache
instance Eq ResetCacheResponse
instance Ord ResetCacheResponse
instance Read ResetCacheResponse
instance Show ResetCacheResponse
instance Monoid ResetCacheResponse
instance FromJSON ResetCacheResponse
instance AWSRequest ResetCache
instance ToJSON ResetCache
instance ToHeaders ResetCache
instance ToQuery ResetCache
instance ToPath ResetCache


-- | This operation lists the iSCSI stored volumes of a gateway. Results
--   are sorted by volume ARN. The response includes only the volume ARNs.
--   If you want additional volume information, use the
--   <tt>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</tt> API.
--   
--   The operation supports pagination. By default, the operation returns a
--   maximum of up to 100 volumes. You can optionally specify the
--   <tt>Limit</tt> field in the body to limit the number of volumes in the
--   response. If the number of volumes returned in the response is
--   truncated, the response includes a Marker field. You can use this
--   Marker value in your subsequent request to retrieve the next set of
--   volumes.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ListVolumes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListVolumes
data ListVolumes

-- | <a>ListVolumes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lvGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lvLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>lvMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listVolumes :: Text -> ListVolumes
lvGatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumes Text

-- | Specifies that the list of volumes returned be limited to the
--   specified number of items.
lvLimit :: Lens' ListVolumes (Maybe Natural)

-- | A string that indicates the position at which to begin the returned
--   list of volumes. Obtain the marker from the response of a previous
--   List iSCSI Volumes request.
lvMarker :: Lens' ListVolumes (Maybe Text)
data ListVolumesResponse

-- | <a>ListVolumesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lvrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lvrMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lvrVolumeInfos</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>VolumeInfo</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
listVolumesResponse :: ListVolumesResponse
lvrGatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumesResponse (Maybe Text)
lvrMarker :: Lens' ListVolumesResponse (Maybe Text)
lvrVolumeInfos :: Lens' ListVolumesResponse [VolumeInfo]
instance Eq ListVolumes
instance Ord ListVolumes
instance Read ListVolumes
instance Show ListVolumes
instance Eq ListVolumesResponse
instance Read ListVolumesResponse
instance Show ListVolumesResponse
instance AWSPager ListVolumes
instance FromJSON ListVolumesResponse
instance AWSRequest ListVolumes
instance ToJSON ListVolumes
instance ToHeaders ListVolumes
instance ToQuery ListVolumes
instance ToPath ListVolumes


-- | This operation lists the recovery points for a specified gateway. This
--   operation is supported only for the gateway-cached volume
--   architecture.
--   
--   Each gateway-cached volume has one recovery point. A volume recovery
--   point is a point in time at which all data of the volume is consistent
--   and from which you can create a snapshot. To create a snapshot from a
--   volume recovery point use the
--   <tt>CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint</tt> operation.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ListVolumeRecoveryPoints.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
data ListVolumeRecoveryPoints

-- | <a>ListVolumeRecoveryPoints</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lvrpGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listVolumeRecoveryPoints :: Text -> ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
lvrpGatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumeRecoveryPoints Text
data ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse

-- | <a>ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lvrprGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>lvrprVolumeRecoveryPointInfos</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>VolumeRecoveryPointInfo</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
listVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse :: ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse
lvrprGatewayARN :: Lens' ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse (Maybe Text)
lvrprVolumeRecoveryPointInfos :: Lens' ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse [VolumeRecoveryPointInfo]
instance Eq ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance Ord ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance Read ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance Show ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance Monoid ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance IsString ListVolumeRecoveryPoints

instance Show ListVolumeRecoveryPointsResponse

instance ToJSON ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance ToHeaders ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance ToQuery ListVolumeRecoveryPoints
instance ToPath ListVolumeRecoveryPoints


-- | This operation returns a list of the gateway's local disks. To specify
--   which gateway to describe, you use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the gateway in the body of the request.
--   
--   The request returns a list of all disks, specifying which are
--   configured as working storage, cache storage, or stored volume or not
--   configured at all. The response includes a <tt>DiskStatus</tt> field.
--   This field can have a value of present (the disk is availble to use),
--   missing (the disk is no longer connected to the gateway), or mismatch
--   (the disk node is occupied by a disk that has incorrect metadata or
--   the disk content is corrupted).
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ListLocalDisks.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListLocalDisks
data ListLocalDisks

-- | <a>ListLocalDisks</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lldGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listLocalDisks :: Text -> ListLocalDisks
lldGatewayARN :: Lens' ListLocalDisks Text
data ListLocalDisksResponse

-- | <a>ListLocalDisksResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>lldrDisks</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Disk</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>lldrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listLocalDisksResponse :: ListLocalDisksResponse
lldrDisks :: Lens' ListLocalDisksResponse [Disk]
lldrGatewayARN :: Lens' ListLocalDisksResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ListLocalDisks
instance Ord ListLocalDisks
instance Read ListLocalDisks
instance Show ListLocalDisks
instance Monoid ListLocalDisks
instance IsString ListLocalDisks
instance Eq ListLocalDisksResponse
instance Read ListLocalDisksResponse
instance Show ListLocalDisksResponse

instance ToJSON ListLocalDisks
instance ToHeaders ListLocalDisks
instance ToQuery ListLocalDisks
instance ToPath ListLocalDisks


-- | This operation lists gateways owned by an AWS account in a region
--   specified in the request. The returned list is ordered by gateway
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   By default, the operation returns a maximum of 100 gateways. This
--   operation supports pagination that allows you to optionally reduce the
--   number of gateways returned in a response.
--   
--   If you have more gateways than are returned in a response-that is, the
--   response returns only a truncated list of your gateways-the response
--   contains a marker that you can specify in your next request to fetch
--   the next page of gateways.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ListGateways.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ListGateways

--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>lgMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listGateways :: ListGateways

-- | Specifies that the list of gateways returned be limited to the
--   specified number of items.
lgLimit :: Lens' ListGateways (Maybe Natural)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin the
--   returned list of gateways.
lgMarker :: Lens' ListGateways (Maybe Text)
data ListGatewaysResponse

-- | <a>ListGatewaysResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   <li><a>lgrMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
listGatewaysResponse :: ListGatewaysResponse
lgrGateways :: Lens' ListGatewaysResponse [GatewayInfo]

-- | Disables a gateway when the gateway is no longer functioning. For
--   example, if your gateway VM is damaged, you can disable the gateway so
--   you can recover virtual tapes.
--   
--   Use this operation for a gateway-VTL that is not reachable or not
--   functioning.
--   
--   Once a gateway is disabled it cannot be enabled.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DisableGateway.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DisableGateway
data DisableGateway

-- | <a>DisableGateway</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   </ul>

--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dgr1GatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
disableGatewayResponse :: DisableGatewayResponse

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name of the disabled gateway.
dgr1GatewayARN :: Lens' DisableGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This operation returns information about the working storage of a
--   gateway. This operation is supported only for the gateway-stored
--   volume architecture. This operation is deprecated in cached-volumes
--   API version (20120630). Use DescribeUploadBuffer instead.
--   
--   Working storage is also referred to as upload buffer. You can also use
--   the DescribeUploadBuffer operation to add upload buffer to a
--   stored-volume gateway.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as working storage,
--   and it includes the amount of working storage allocated and used.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeWorkingStorage.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeWorkingStorage
data DescribeWorkingStorage

-- | <a>DescribeWorkingStorage</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dwsGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeWorkingStorage :: Text -> DescribeWorkingStorage
dwsGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeWorkingStorage Text
data DescribeWorkingStorageResponse

-- | <a>DescribeWorkingStorageResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dwsrDiskIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dwsrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dwsrWorkingStorageAllocatedInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>dwsrWorkingStorageUsedInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeWorkingStorageResponse :: DescribeWorkingStorageResponse

-- | An array of the gateway's local disk IDs that are configured as
--   working storage. Each local disk ID is specified as a string (minimum
--   length of 1 and maximum length of 300). If no local disks are
--   configured as working storage, then the DiskIds array is empty.
dwsrDiskIds :: Lens' DescribeWorkingStorageResponse [Text]
dwsrGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeWorkingStorageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total working storage in bytes allocated for the gateway. If no
--   working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.
dwsrWorkingStorageAllocatedInBytes :: Lens' DescribeWorkingStorageResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total working storage in bytes in use by the gateway. If no
--   working storage is configured for the gateway, this field returns 0.
dwsrWorkingStorageUsedInBytes :: Lens' DescribeWorkingStorageResponse (Maybe Integer)
instance Eq DescribeWorkingStorage
instance Ord DescribeWorkingStorage
instance Read DescribeWorkingStorage
instance Show DescribeWorkingStorage
instance Monoid DescribeWorkingStorage
instance IsString DescribeWorkingStorage
instance Eq DescribeWorkingStorageResponse
instance Ord DescribeWorkingStorageResponse
instance Read DescribeWorkingStorageResponse
instance Show DescribeWorkingStorageResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeWorkingStorageResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeWorkingStorage
instance ToJSON DescribeWorkingStorage
instance ToHeaders DescribeWorkingStorage
instance ToQuery DescribeWorkingStorage
instance ToPath DescribeWorkingStorage


-- | Returns a description of virtual tape library (VTL) devices for the
--   specified gateway. In the response, AWS Storage Gateway returns VTL
--   device information.
--   
--   The list of VTL devices must be from one gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeVTLDevices.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeVTLDevices
data DescribeVTLDevices

-- | <a>DescribeVTLDevices</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvtldGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvtldLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvtldMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvtldVTLDeviceARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeVTLDevices :: Text -> DescribeVTLDevices
dvtldGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevices Text

-- | Specifies that the number of VTL devices described be limited to the
--   specified number.
dvtldLimit :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevices (Maybe Natural)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   describing the VTL devices.
dvtldMarker :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevices (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of strings, where each string represents the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a VTL device.
--   
--   All of the specified VTL devices must be from the same gateway. If no
--   VTL devices are specified, the result will contain all devices on the
--   specified gateway.
dvtldVTLDeviceARNs :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevices [Text]
data DescribeVTLDevicesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeVTLDevicesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvtldrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvtldrMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dvtldrVTLDevices</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>VTLDevice</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeVTLDevicesResponse :: DescribeVTLDevicesResponse
dvtldrGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevicesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which the VTL devices
--   that were fetched for description ended. Use the marker in your next
--   request to fetch the next set of VTL devices in the list. If there are
--   no more VTL devices to describe, this field does not appear in the
--   response.
dvtldrMarker :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevicesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of VTL device objects composed of the Amazon Resource
--   Name(ARN) of the VTL devices.
dvtldrVTLDevices :: Lens' DescribeVTLDevicesResponse [VTLDevice]
instance Eq DescribeVTLDevices
instance Ord DescribeVTLDevices
instance Read DescribeVTLDevices
instance Show DescribeVTLDevices
instance Eq DescribeVTLDevicesResponse
instance Read DescribeVTLDevicesResponse
instance Show DescribeVTLDevicesResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeVTLDevices
instance FromJSON DescribeVTLDevicesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeVTLDevices
instance ToJSON DescribeVTLDevices
instance ToHeaders DescribeVTLDevices
instance ToQuery DescribeVTLDevices
instance ToPath DescribeVTLDevices


-- | This operation returns information about the upload buffer of a
--   gateway. This operation is supported for both the gateway-stored and
--   gateway-cached volume architectures.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as upload buffer
--   space, and it includes the amount of upload buffer space allocated and
--   used.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeUploadBuffer.html</a>

--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--

--   <li><a>dubrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dubrUploadBufferAllocatedInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>dubrUploadBufferUsedInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeUploadBufferResponse :: DescribeUploadBufferResponse

dubrUploadBufferUsedInBytes :: Lens' DescribeUploadBufferResponse (Maybe Integer)

instance Read DescribeUploadBuffer
instance Show DescribeUploadBuffer
instance Monoid DescribeUploadBuffer
instance IsString DescribeUploadBuffer

instance Ord DescribeUploadBufferResponse
instance Read DescribeUploadBufferResponse
instance Show DescribeUploadBufferResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeUploadBufferResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeUploadBuffer
instance ToJSON DescribeUploadBuffer
instance ToHeaders DescribeUploadBuffer
instance ToQuery DescribeUploadBuffer
instance ToPath DescribeUploadBuffer


-- | Returns a description of the specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   virtual tapes. If a <tt>TapeARN</tt> is not specified, returns a
--   description of all virtual tapes associated with the specified
--   gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeTapes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapes
data DescribeTapes

-- | <a>DescribeTapes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtTapeARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTapes :: Text -> DescribeTapes
dtGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeTapes Text

-- | Specifies that the number of virtual tapes described be limited to the
--   specified number.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services may impose its own limit, if this field is not
--   set.
dtLimit :: Lens' DescribeTapes (Maybe Natural)

-- | A marker value, obtained in a previous call to <a>DescribeTapes</a>.
--   This marker indicates which page of results to retrieve.
--   
--   If not specified, the first page of results is retrieved.
dtMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapes (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that
--   represent the virtual tapes you want to describe. If this parameter is
--   not specified, AWS Storage Gateway returns a description of all
--   virtual tapes associated with the specified gateway.
dtTapeARNs :: Lens' DescribeTapes [Text]
data DescribeTapesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeTapesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtrMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrTapes</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Tape</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTapesResponse :: DescribeTapesResponse

-- | An opaque string which can be used as part of a subsequent
--   DescribeTapes call to retrieve the next page of results.
--   
--   If a response does not contain a marker, then there are no more
--   results to be retrieved.
dtrMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of virtual tape descriptions.
dtrTapes :: Lens' DescribeTapesResponse [Tape]
instance Eq DescribeTapes
instance Ord DescribeTapes
instance Read DescribeTapes
instance Show DescribeTapes
instance Eq DescribeTapesResponse
instance Read DescribeTapesResponse
instance Show DescribeTapesResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeTapes
instance FromJSON DescribeTapesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeTapes
instance ToJSON DescribeTapes
instance ToHeaders DescribeTapes
instance ToQuery DescribeTapes
instance ToPath DescribeTapes


-- | Returns a list of virtual tape recovery points that are available for
--   the specified gateway-VTL.
--   
--   A recovery point is a point in time view of a virtual tape at which
--   all the data on the virtual tape is consistent. If your gateway
--   crashes, virtual tapes that have recovery points can be recovered to a
--   new gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
data DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints

-- | <a>DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtrpGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrpLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrpMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeTapeRecoveryPoints :: Text -> DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
dtrpGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints Text

-- | Specifies that the number of virtual tape recovery points that are
--   described be limited to the specified number.
dtrpLimit :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints (Maybe Natural)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   describing the virtual tape recovery points.
dtrpMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints (Maybe Text)
data DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtrprGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrprMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtrprTapeRecoveryPointInfos</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>TapeRecoveryPointInfo</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse :: DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse
dtrprGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which the virtual tape
--   recovery points that were listed for description ended.
--   
--   Use this marker in your next request to list the next set of virtual
--   tape recovery points in the list. If there are no more recovery points
--   to describe, this field does not appear in the response.
dtrprMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of TapeRecoveryPointInfos that are available for the
--   specified gateway.
dtrprTapeRecoveryPointInfos :: Lens' DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse [TapeRecoveryPointInfo]
instance Eq DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance Ord DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance Read DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance Show DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance Eq DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse
instance Read DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse
instance Show DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance FromJSON DescribeTapeRecoveryPointsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance ToJSON DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance ToHeaders DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance ToQuery DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints
instance ToPath DescribeTapeRecoveryPoints


-- | Returns a description of specified virtual tapes in the virtual tape
--   shelf (VTS).
--   
--   If a specific <tt>TapeARN</tt> is not specified, AWS Storage Gateway
--   returns a description of all virtual tapes found in the VTS associated
--   with your account.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeTapeArchives.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeTapeArchives
data DescribeTapeArchives

-- | <a>DescribeTapeArchives</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtaLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtaMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtaTapeARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTapeArchives :: DescribeTapeArchives

-- | Specifies that the number of virtual tapes descried be limited to the
--   specified number.
dtaLimit :: Lens' DescribeTapeArchives (Maybe Natural)

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin
--   describing virtual tapes.
dtaMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapeArchives (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies one or more unique Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that
--   represent the virtual tapes you want to describe.
dtaTapeARNs :: Lens' DescribeTapeArchives [Text]
data DescribeTapeArchivesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeTapeArchivesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dtarMarker</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dtarTapeArchives</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>TapeArchive</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeTapeArchivesResponse :: DescribeTapeArchivesResponse

-- | An opaque string that indicates the position at which the virtual
--   tapes that were fetched for description ended. Use this marker in your
--   next request to fetch the next set of virtual tapes in the virtual
--   tape shelf (VTS). If there are no more virtual tapes to describe, this
--   field does not appear in the response.
dtarMarker :: Lens' DescribeTapeArchivesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of virtual tape objects in the virtual tape shelf (VTS). The
--   description includes of the Amazon Resource Name(ARN) of the virtual
--   tapes. The information returned includes the Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs) of the tapes, size of the tapes, status of the tapes, progress
--   of the description and tape barcode.
dtarTapeArchives :: Lens' DescribeTapeArchivesResponse [TapeArchive]
instance Eq DescribeTapeArchives
instance Ord DescribeTapeArchives
instance Read DescribeTapeArchives
instance Show DescribeTapeArchives
instance Eq DescribeTapeArchivesResponse
instance Read DescribeTapeArchivesResponse
instance Show DescribeTapeArchivesResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeTapeArchives
instance FromJSON DescribeTapeArchivesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeTapeArchives
instance ToJSON DescribeTapeArchives
instance ToHeaders DescribeTapeArchives
instance ToQuery DescribeTapeArchives
instance ToPath DescribeTapeArchives


-- | This operation returns description of the gateway volumes specified in
--   the request. The list of gateway volumes in the request must be from
--   one gateway. In the response Amazon Storage Gateway returns volume
--   information sorted by volume ARNs.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
data DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes

-- | <a>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsscsivVolumeARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeStorediSCSIVolumes :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes

-- | An array of strings where each string represents the Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a stored volume. All of the specified stored volumes
--   must from the same gateway. Use <tt>ListVolumes</tt> to get volume
--   ARNs for a gateway.
dsscsivVolumeARNs :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes [Text]
data DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dsscsivrStorediSCSIVolumes</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>StorediSCSIVolume</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse :: DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
dsscsivrStorediSCSIVolumes :: Lens' DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse [StorediSCSIVolume]
instance Eq DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Ord DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Read DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Show DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Monoid DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Semigroup DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance Eq DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Read DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Show DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Monoid DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance ToJSON DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance ToHeaders DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance ToQuery DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance ToPath DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes
instance IsList DescribeStorediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance IsList DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes


-- | This operation describes the snapshot schedule for the specified
--   gateway volume. The snapshot schedule information includes intervals
--   at which snapshots are automatically initiated on the volume.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeSnapshotSchedule.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeSnapshotSchedule
data DescribeSnapshotSchedule

-- | <a>DescribeSnapshotSchedule</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dssVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeSnapshotSchedule :: Text -> DescribeSnapshotSchedule

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the
--   <tt>ListVolumes</tt> operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
dssVolumeARN :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotSchedule Text
data DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse

-- | <a>DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dssrDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dssrRecurrenceInHours</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dssrStartAt</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dssrTimezone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dssrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeSnapshotScheduleResponse :: DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
dssrDescription :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Text)
dssrRecurrenceInHours :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Natural)
dssrStartAt :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Natural)
dssrTimezone :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Text)
dssrVolumeARN :: Lens' DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance Ord DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance Read DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance Show DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance Monoid DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance IsString DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance Eq DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Ord DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Read DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance Show DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeSnapshotScheduleResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance ToJSON DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance ToHeaders DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance ToQuery DescribeSnapshotSchedule
instance ToPath DescribeSnapshotSchedule


-- | This operation returns your gateway's weekly maintenance start time
--   including the day and time of the week. Note that values are in terms
--   of the gateway's time zone.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeMaintenanceStartTime.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
data DescribeMaintenanceStartTime

-- | <a>DescribeMaintenanceStartTime</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dmstGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeMaintenanceStartTime :: Text -> DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
dmstGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTime Text
data DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse

-- | <a>DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dmstrDayOfWeek</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dmstrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dmstrHourOfDay</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dmstrMinuteOfHour</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dmstrTimezone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse :: DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse
dmstrDayOfWeek :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Natural)
dmstrGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Text)
dmstrHourOfDay :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Natural)
dmstrMinuteOfHour :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Natural)
dmstrTimezone :: Lens' DescribeMaintenanceStartTimeResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
instance Ord DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
instance Read DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
instance Show DescribeMaintenanceStartTime
instance Monoid DescribeMaintenanceStartTime

-- | This operation returns metadata about a gateway such as its name,
--   network interfaces, configured time zone, and the state (whether the
--   gateway is running or not). To specify which gateway to describe, use
--   the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeGatewayInformation.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeGatewayInformation
data DescribeGatewayInformation

-- | <a>DescribeGatewayInformation</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dgiGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeGatewayInformation :: Text -> DescribeGatewayInformation
dgiGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformation Text
data DescribeGatewayInformationResponse

-- | <a>DescribeGatewayInformationResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayNetworkInterfaces</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>NetworkInterface</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayState</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayTimezone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dgirGatewayType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dgirNextUpdateAvailabilityDate</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeGatewayInformationResponse :: DescribeGatewayInformationResponse
dgirGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The gateway ID.
dgirGatewayId :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A <a>NetworkInterface</a> array that contains descriptions of the
--   gateway network interfaces.
dgirGatewayNetworkInterfaces :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse [NetworkInterface]

-- | One of the values that indicates the operating state of the gateway.
dgirGatewayState :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | One of the values that indicates the time zone configured for the
--   gateway.
dgirGatewayTimezone :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | TBD
dgirGatewayType :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date at which an update to the gateway is available. This date is
--   in the time zone of the gateway. If the gateway is not available for
--   an update this field is not returned in the response.
dgirNextUpdateAvailabilityDate :: Lens' DescribeGatewayInformationResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeGatewayInformation
instance Ord DescribeGatewayInformation
instance Read DescribeGatewayInformation
instance Show DescribeGatewayInformation
instance Monoid DescribeGatewayInformation
instance IsString DescribeGatewayInformation
instance Eq DescribeGatewayInformationResponse
instance Read DescribeGatewayInformationResponse
instance Show DescribeGatewayInformationResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeGatewayInformationResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeGatewayInformation
instance ToJSON DescribeGatewayInformation
instance ToHeaders DescribeGatewayInformation
instance ToQuery DescribeGatewayInformation
instance ToPath DescribeGatewayInformation


-- | This operation returns an array of Challenge-Handshake Authentication
--   Protocol (CHAP) credentials information for a specified iSCSI target,
--   one for each target-initiator pair.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeChapCredentials.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeChapCredentials
data DescribeChapCredentials

-- | <a>DescribeChapCredentials</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dccTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeChapCredentials :: Text -> DescribeChapCredentials

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the iSCSI volume target. Use the
--   <tt>DescribeStorediSCSIVolumes</tt> operation to return to retrieve
--   the TargetARN for specified VolumeARN.
dccTargetARN :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentials Text
data DescribeChapCredentialsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeChapCredentialsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dccrChapCredentials</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>ChapInfo</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeChapCredentialsResponse :: DescribeChapCredentialsResponse

-- | An array of <a>ChapInfo</a> objects that represent CHAP credentials.
--   Each object in the array contains CHAP credential information for one
--   target-initiator pair. If no CHAP credentials are set, an empty array
--   is returned. CHAP credential information is provided in a JSON object
--   with the following fields:
--   
--   InitiatorName: The iSCSI initiator that connects to the target.
--   
--   SecretToAuthenticateInitiator: The secret key that the initiator (e.g.
--   Windows client) must provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the
--   target.
--   
--   SecretToAuthenticateTarget: The secret key that the target must
--   provide to participate in mutual CHAP with the initiator (e.g. Windows
--   client).
--   
--   TargetARN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.
dccrChapCredentials :: Lens' DescribeChapCredentialsResponse [ChapInfo]
instance Eq DescribeChapCredentials
instance Ord DescribeChapCredentials
instance Read DescribeChapCredentials
instance Show DescribeChapCredentials
instance Monoid DescribeChapCredentials
instance IsString DescribeChapCredentials
instance Eq DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance Read DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance Show DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance Monoid DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeChapCredentialsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeChapCredentials
instance ToJSON DescribeChapCredentials
instance ToHeaders DescribeChapCredentials
instance ToQuery DescribeChapCredentials
instance ToPath DescribeChapCredentials
instance IsList DescribeChapCredentialsResponse


-- | This operation returns a description of the gateway volumes specified
--   in the request. This operation is supported only for the
--   gateway-cached volume architecture.
--   
--   The list of gateway volumes in the request must be from one gateway.
--   In the response Amazon Storage Gateway returns volume information
--   sorted by volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
data DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes

-- | <a>DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcscsivVolumeARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeCachediSCSIVolumes :: DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
dcscsivVolumeARNs :: Lens' DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes [Text]
data DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcscsivrCachediSCSIVolumes</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>CachediSCSIVolume</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse :: DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse

-- | An array of objects where each object contains metadata about one
--   cached volume.
dcscsivrCachediSCSIVolumes :: Lens' DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse [CachediSCSIVolume]
instance Eq DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Ord DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Read DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Show DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Monoid DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Semigroup DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance Eq DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Read DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Show DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Monoid DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance Semigroup DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance ToJSON DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance ToHeaders DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance ToQuery DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance ToPath DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes
instance IsList DescribeCachediSCSIVolumesResponse
instance IsList DescribeCachediSCSIVolumes


-- | This operation returns information about the cache of a gateway. This
--   operation is supported only for the gateway-cached volume
--   architecture.
--   
--   The response includes disk IDs that are configured as cache, and it
--   includes the amount of cache allocated and used.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeCache.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeCache
data DescribeCache

-- | <a>DescribeCache</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeCache :: Text -> DescribeCache
dcGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeCache Text
data DescribeCacheResponse

-- | <a>DescribeCacheResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dcrCacheAllocatedInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcrCacheDirtyPercentage</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcrCacheHitPercentage</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcrCacheMissPercentage</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcrCacheUsedPercentage</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Double</a></li>
--   <li><a>dcrDiskIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>dcrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeCacheResponse :: DescribeCacheResponse
dcrCacheAllocatedInBytes :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Integer)
dcrCacheDirtyPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)
dcrCacheHitPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)
dcrCacheMissPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)
dcrCacheUsedPercentage :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Double)
dcrDiskIds :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse [Text]
dcrGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeCacheResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeCache
instance Ord DescribeCache
instance Read DescribeCache
instance Show DescribeCache
instance Monoid DescribeCache
instance IsString DescribeCache
instance Eq DescribeCacheResponse

instance Read DescribeCacheResponse
instance Show DescribeCacheResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeCacheResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeCache
instance ToJSON DescribeCache
instance ToHeaders DescribeCache
instance ToQuery DescribeCache
instance ToPath DescribeCache


-- | This operation returns the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. By
--   default, these limits are not set, which means no bandwidth rate
--   limiting is in effect.
--   
--   This operation only returns a value for a bandwidth rate limit only if
--   the limit is set. If no limits are set for the gateway, then this
--   operation returns only the gateway ARN in the response body. To
--   specify which gateway to describe, use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the gateway in your request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeBandwidthRateLimit.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
data DescribeBandwidthRateLimit

-- | <a>DescribeBandwidthRateLimit</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dbrlGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeBandwidthRateLimit :: Text -> DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
dbrlGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeBandwidthRateLimit Text
data DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse

-- | <a>DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dbrlrAverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbrlrAverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbrlrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeBandwidthRateLimitResponse :: DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse

-- | The average download bandwidth rate limit in bits per second. This
--   field does not appear in the response if the download rate limit is
--   not set.
dbrlrAverageDownloadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse (Maybe Natural)

-- | The average upload bandwidth rate limit in bits per second. This field
--   does not appear in the response if the upload rate limit is not set.
dbrlrAverageUploadRateLimitInBitsPerSec :: Lens' DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse (Maybe Natural)
dbrlrGatewayARN :: Lens' DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance Ord DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance Read DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance Show DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance Monoid DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance IsString DescribeBandwidthRateLimit
instance Eq DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Ord DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Read DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance Show DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse
instance FromJSON DescribeBandwidthRateLimitResponse

-- | This operation delete the specified gateway volume that you previously
--   created using the <tt>CreateStorediSCSIVolume</tt> API. For
--   gateway-stored volumes, the local disk that was configured as the
--   storage volume is not deleted. You can reuse the local disk to create
--   another storage volume.
--   
--   Before you delete a gateway volume, make sure there are no iSCSI
--   connections to the volume you are deleting. You should also make sure
--   there is no snapshot in progress. You can use the Amazon Elastic
--   Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) API to query snapshots on the volume you
--   are deleting and check the snapshot status. For more information, go
--   to <a>DescribeSnapshots</a> in the <i>AmazonElastic Compute Cloud API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   In the request, you must provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   storage volume you want to delete.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteVolume
data DeleteVolume

-- | <a>DeleteVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteVolume :: Text -> DeleteVolume

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the
--   <tt>ListVolumes</tt> operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
dvVolumeARN :: Lens' DeleteVolume Text
data DeleteVolumeResponse

-- | <a>DeleteVolumeResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dvrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteVolumeResponse :: DeleteVolumeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume that was deleted.
--   It is the same ARN you provided in the request.
dvrVolumeARN :: Lens' DeleteVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DeleteVolume
instance Ord DeleteVolume
instance Read DeleteVolume
instance Show DeleteVolume
instance Monoid DeleteVolume
instance IsString DeleteVolume
instance Eq DeleteVolumeResponse
instance Ord DeleteVolumeResponse
instance Read DeleteVolumeResponse
instance Show DeleteVolumeResponse
instance Monoid DeleteVolumeResponse
instance FromJSON DeleteVolumeResponse
instance AWSRequest DeleteVolume
instance ToJSON DeleteVolume
instance ToHeaders DeleteVolume
instance ToQuery DeleteVolume
instance ToPath DeleteVolume

-- | This operation deletes a snapshot of a volume.

--   You can take snapshots of your gateway volumes on a scheduled or
--   ad-hoc basis. This API enables you to delete a snapshot schedule for a
--   volume. For more information, see <a>Working with Snapshots</a>. In
--   the <a>DeleteSnapshotSchedule</a> request, you identify the volume by
--   providing its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. in
--   <i>AmazonElastic Compute Cloud API Reference</i>.

-- | This operation deletes a gateway. To specify which gateway to delete,
--   use the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request. The
--   operation deletes the gateway; however, it does not delete the gateway
--   virtual machine (VM) from your host computer.
--   
--   After you delete a gateway, you cannot reactivate it. Completed
--   snapshots of the gateway volumes are not deleted upon deleting the
--   gateway, however, pending snapshots will not complete. After you
--   delete a gateway, your next step is to remove it from your
--   environment.
--   
--   You no longer pay software charges after the gateway is deleted;
--   however, your existing Amazon EBS snapshots persist and you will
--   continue to be billed for these snapshots. You can choose to remove
--   all remaining Amazon EBS snapshots by canceling your Amazon EC2
--   subscription. If you prefer not to cancel your Amazon EC2
--   subscription, you can delete your snapshots using the Amazon EC2
--   console. For more information, see the <a>AWS Storage Gateway
--   DetailPage</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteGateway.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.DeleteGateway
data DeleteGateway

-- | <a>DeleteGateway</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dgGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteGateway :: Text -> DeleteGateway
dgGatewayARN :: Lens' DeleteGateway Text
data DeleteGatewayResponse

-- | <a>DeleteGatewayResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dgrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteGatewayResponse :: DeleteGatewayResponse
dgrGatewayARN :: Lens' DeleteGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq DeleteGateway
instance Ord DeleteGateway
instance Read DeleteGateway
instance Show DeleteGateway

-- | This operation deletes the bandwidth rate limits of a gateway. You can
--   delete either the upload and download bandwidth rate limit, or you can
--   delete both. If you delete only one of the limits, the other limit
--   remains unchanged. To specify which gateway to work with, use the
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway in your request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteBandwidthRateLimit.html</a>
