-- | Creates one or more virtual tapes. You write data to the virtual tapes
--   and then archive the tapes.
--   
--   Cache storage must be allocated to the gateway before you can create
--   virtual tapes. Use the <tt>AddCache</tt> operation to add cache
--   storage to a gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CreateTapes.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateTapes
data CreateTapes

-- | <a>CreateTapes</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ctClientToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ctGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ctNumTapesToCreate</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ctTapeBarcodePrefix</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ctTapeSizeInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Integer</a></li>
--   </ul>
createTapes :: Text -> Integer -> Text -> Natural -> Text -> CreateTapes

-- | A unique identifier that you use to retry a request. If you retry a
--   request, use the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> you specified in the
--   initial request.
--   
--   Using the same <tt>ClientToken</tt> prevents creating the tape
--   multiple times.
ctClientToken :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | The unique Amazon Resource Name(ARN) that represents the gateway to
--   associate the virtual tapes with. Use the <tt>ListGateways</tt>
--   operation to return a list of gateways for your account and region.
ctGatewayARN :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | The number of virtual tapes you want to create.
ctNumTapesToCreate :: Lens' CreateTapes Natural

-- | A prefix you append to the barcode of the virtual tape you are
--   creating. This makes a barcode unique.
--   
--   The prefix must be 1 to 4 characters in length and must be upper-case
--   letters A-Z.
ctTapeBarcodePrefix :: Lens' CreateTapes Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes you want to create.
--   
--   The size must be gigabyte (1024*1024*1024 byte) aligned.
ctTapeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CreateTapes Integer
data CreateTapesResponse

-- | <a>CreateTapesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ctrTapeARNs</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
createTapesResponse :: CreateTapesResponse

-- | A list of unique Amazon Resource Named (ARN) the represents the
--   virtual tapes that were created.
ctrTapeARNs :: Lens' CreateTapesResponse [Text]
instance Eq CreateTapes
instance Ord CreateTapes
instance Read CreateTapes
instance Show CreateTapes
instance Eq CreateTapesResponse
instance Ord CreateTapesResponse
instance Read CreateTapesResponse
instance Show CreateTapesResponse
instance Monoid CreateTapesResponse
instance Semigroup CreateTapesResponse
instance FromJSON CreateTapesResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateTapes
instance ToJSON CreateTapes
instance ToHeaders CreateTapes
instance ToQuery CreateTapes
instance ToPath CreateTapes
instance IsList CreateTapesResponse


-- | This operation creates a volume on a specified gateway. This operation
--   is supported only for the gateway-stored volume architecture.
--   
--   The size of the volume to create is inferred from the disk size. You
--   can choose to preserve existing data on the disk, create volume from
--   an existing snapshot, or create an empty volume. If you choose to
--   create an empty gateway volume, then any existing data on the disk is
--   erased.
--   
--   In the request you must specify the gateway and the disk information
--   on which you are creating the volume. In response, AWS Storage Gateway
--   creates the volume and returns volume information such as the volume
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN), its size, and the iSCSI target ARN that
--   initiators can use to connect to the volume target.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CreateStorediSCSIVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateStorediSCSIVolume
data CreateStorediSCSIVolume

-- | <a>CreateStorediSCSIVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csscsivDiskId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivNetworkInterfaceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivPreserveExistingData</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivTargetName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createStorediSCSIVolume :: Text -> Text -> Bool -> Text -> Text -> CreateStorediSCSIVolume

-- | The unique identifier for the gateway local disk that is configured as
--   a stored volume. Use <a>ListLocalDisks</a> to list disk IDs for a
--   gateway.
csscsivDiskId :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text
csscsivGatewayARN :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text

-- | The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI
--   target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted. Use
--   <tt>DescribeGatewayInformation</tt> to get a list of the network
--   interfaces available on a gateway.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: A valid IP address.
csscsivNetworkInterfaceId :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text

-- | Specify this field as true if you want to preserve the data on the
--   local disk. Otherwise, specifying this field as false creates an empty
--   volume.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: true, false
csscsivPreserveExistingData :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Bool

-- | The snapshot ID (e.g. "snap-1122aabb") of the snapshot to restore as
--   the new stored volume. Specify this field if you want to create the
--   iSCSI storage volume from a snapshot otherwise do not include this
--   field. To list snapshots for your account use <a>DescribeSnapshots</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Elastic Compute CloudAPI Reference</i>.
csscsivSnapshotId :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the iSCSI target used by initiators to connect to the
--   target and as a suffix for the target ARN. For example, specifying
--   <tt>TargetName</tt> as <i>myvolume</i> results in the target ARN of
--   arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-1:111122223333:gateway<i>mygateway</i>target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume.
--   The target name must be unique across all volumes of a gateway.
csscsivTargetName :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolume Text
data CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse

-- | <a>CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csscsivrTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csscsivrVolumeSizeInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Integer</a></li>
--   </ul>
createStorediSCSIVolumeResponse :: CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse

-- | he Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target that includes the
--   iSCSI name that initiators can use to connect to the target.
csscsivrTargetARN :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configured volume.
csscsivrVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the volume in bytes.
csscsivrVolumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse (Maybe Integer)
instance Eq CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance Ord CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance Read CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance Show CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance Eq CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Ord CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Read CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Show CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance FromJSON CreateStorediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance ToJSON CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance ToHeaders CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance ToQuery CreateStorediSCSIVolume
instance ToPath CreateStorediSCSIVolume


-- | This operation initiates a snapshot of a gateway from a volume
--   recovery point. This operation is supported only for the
--   gateway-cached volume architecture (see ).
--   
--   A volume recovery point is a point in time at which all data of the
--   volume is consistent and from which you can create a snapshot. To get
--   a list of volume recovery point for gateway-cached volumes, use
--   <tt>ListVolumeRecoveryPoints</tt> .
--   
--   In the <a>CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint</a> request, you
--   identify the volume by providing its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). You
--   must also provide a description for the snapshot. When AWS Storage
--   Gateway takes a snapshot of the specified volume, the snapshot and its
--   description appear in the AWS Storage Gateway console. In response,
--   AWS Storage Gateway returns you a snapshot ID. You can use this
--   snapshot ID to check the snapshot progress or later use it when you
--   want to create a volume from a snapshot.
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. For
--   more information, in <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
data CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint

-- | <a>CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csfvrpSnapshotDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csfvrpVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint :: Text -> Text -> CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
csfvrpSnapshotDescription :: Lens' CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint Text
csfvrpVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint Text
data CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse

-- | <a>CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csfvrprSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csfvrprVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csfvrprVolumeRecoveryPointTime</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse :: CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
csfvrprSnapshotId :: Lens' CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)
csfvrprVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)
csfvrprVolumeRecoveryPointTime :: Lens' CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance Ord CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance Read CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance Show CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance Eq CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Ord CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Read CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
instance Show CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
instance FromJSON CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPointResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance ToJSON CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance ToHeaders CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance ToQuery CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint
instance ToPath CreateSnapshotFromVolumeRecoveryPoint


-- | This operation initiates a snapshot of a volume.
--   
--   AWS Storage Gateway provides the ability to back up point-in-time
--   snapshots of your data to Amazon Simple Storage (S3) for durable
--   off-site recovery, as well as import the data to an Amazon Elastic
--   Block Store (EBS) volume in Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2). You
--   can take snapshots of your gateway volume on a scheduled or ad-hoc
--   basis. This API enables you to take ad-hoc snapshot. For more
--   information, see <a>Working With Snapshots in the AWS StorageGateway
--   Console</a>.
--   
--   In the CreateSnapshot request you identify the volume by providing its
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN). You must also provide description for the
--   snapshot. When AWS Storage Gateway takes the snapshot of specified
--   volume, the snapshot and description appears in the AWS Storage
--   Gateway Console. In response, AWS Storage Gateway returns you a
--   snapshot ID. You can use this snapshot ID to check the snapshot
--   progress or later use it when you want to create a volume from a
--   snapshot.
--   
--   To list or delete a snapshot, you must use the Amazon EC2 API. For
--   more information, .
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CreateSnapshot.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateSnapshot
data CreateSnapshot

-- | <a>CreateSnapshot</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csSnapshotDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createSnapshot :: Text -> Text -> CreateSnapshot

-- | Textual description of the snapshot that appears in the Amazon EC2
--   console, Elastic Block Store snapshots panel in the Description field,
--   and in the AWS Storage Gateway snapshot Details pane, Description
--   field
csSnapshotDescription :: Lens' CreateSnapshot Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume. Use the
--   <tt>ListVolumes</tt> operation to return a list of gateway volumes.
csVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshot Text
data CreateSnapshotResponse

-- | <a>CreateSnapshotResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>csrSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>csrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createSnapshotResponse :: CreateSnapshotResponse

-- | The snapshot ID that is used to refer to the snapshot in future
--   operations such as describing snapshots (Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   API <tt>DescribeSnapshots</tt>) or creating a volume from a snapshot
--   (<tt>CreateStorediSCSIVolume</tt>).
csrSnapshotId :: Lens' CreateSnapshotResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume of which the snapshot was
--   taken.
csrVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateSnapshotResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateSnapshot
instance Ord CreateSnapshot
instance Read CreateSnapshot
instance Show CreateSnapshot
instance Eq CreateSnapshotResponse
instance Ord CreateSnapshotResponse
instance Read CreateSnapshotResponse
instance Show CreateSnapshotResponse
instance FromJSON CreateSnapshotResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateSnapshot
instance ToJSON CreateSnapshot
instance ToHeaders CreateSnapshot
instance ToQuery CreateSnapshot
instance ToPath CreateSnapshot


-- | This operation creates a cached volume on a specified cached gateway.
--   This operation is supported only for the gateway-cached volume
--   architecture.
--   
--   Cache storage must be allocated to the gateway before you can create a
--   cached volume. Use the <tt>AddCache</tt> operation to add cache
--   storage to a gateway. In the request, you must specify the gateway,
--   size of the volume in bytes, the iSCSI target name, an IP address on
--   which to expose the target, and a unique client token. In response,
--   AWS Storage Gateway creates the volume and returns information about
--   it such as the volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN), its size, and the
--   iSCSI target ARN that initiators can use to connect to the volume
--   target.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CreateCachediSCSIVolume.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CreateCachediSCSIVolume
data CreateCachediSCSIVolume

-- | <a>CreateCachediSCSIVolume</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ccscsivClientToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivNetworkInterfaceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivSnapshotId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivTargetName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivVolumeSizeInBytes</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Integer</a></li>
--   </ul>
createCachediSCSIVolume :: Text -> Integer -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateCachediSCSIVolume
ccscsivClientToken :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume Text
ccscsivGatewayARN :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume Text
ccscsivNetworkInterfaceId :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume Text
ccscsivSnapshotId :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume (Maybe Text)
ccscsivTargetName :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume Text
ccscsivVolumeSizeInBytes :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolume Integer
data CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse

-- | <a>CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ccscsivrTargetARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ccscsivrVolumeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createCachediSCSIVolumeResponse :: CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
ccscsivrTargetARN :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)
ccscsivrVolumeARN :: Lens' CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance Ord CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance Read CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance Show CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance Eq CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Ord CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Read CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance Show CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance FromJSON CreateCachediSCSIVolumeResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance ToJSON CreateCachediSCSIVolume
instance ToHeaders CreateCachediSCSIVolume

-- | Cancels retrieval of a virtual tape from the virtual tape shelf (VTS)
--   to a gateway after the retrieval process is initiated. The virtual
--   tape is returned to the VTS.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_CancelRetrieval.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.CancelRetrieval

-- | <a>CancelRetrieval</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>crGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>crTapeARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
cancelRetrieval :: Text -> Text -> CancelRetrieval

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape you want to cancel
--   retrieval for.
crTapeARN :: Lens' CancelRetrieval Text

--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>

--   </ul>
cancelRetrievalResponse :: CancelRetrievalResponse

--   was canceled.

-- | This operation configures one or more gateway local disks as working
--   storage for a gateway. This operation is supported only for the
--   gateway-stored volume architecture. This operation is deprecated
--   method in cached-volumes API version (20120630). Use AddUploadBuffer
--   instead.
--   
--   Working storage is also referred to as upload buffer. You can also use
--   the <tt>AddUploadBuffer</tt> operation to add upload buffer to a
--   stored-volume gateway.
--   
--   In the request, you specify the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   which you want to add working storage, and one or more disk IDs that
--   you want to configure as working storage.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_AddWorkingStorage.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AddWorkingStorage
data AddWorkingStorage

-- | <a>AddWorkingStorage</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>awsDiskIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>awsGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
addWorkingStorage :: Text -> AddWorkingStorage

-- | An array of strings that identify disks that are to be configured as
--   working storage. Each string have a minimum length of 1 and maximum
--   length of 300. You can get the disk IDs from the
--   <tt>ListLocalDisks</tt> API.
awsDiskIds :: Lens' AddWorkingStorage [Text]
awsGatewayARN :: Lens' AddWorkingStorage Text
data AddWorkingStorageResponse

-- | <a>AddWorkingStorageResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>awsrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
addWorkingStorageResponse :: AddWorkingStorageResponse
awsrGatewayARN :: Lens' AddWorkingStorageResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq AddWorkingStorage
instance Ord AddWorkingStorage
instance Read AddWorkingStorage
instance Show AddWorkingStorage

instance FromJSON AddWorkingStorageResponse
instance AWSRequest AddWorkingStorage
instance ToJSON AddWorkingStorage
instance ToHeaders AddWorkingStorage
instance ToQuery AddWorkingStorage
instance ToPath AddWorkingStorage


-- | This operation configures one or more gateway local disks as upload

--   the gateway-stored and gateway-cached volume architectures.
--   
--   In the request, you specify the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   which you want to add upload buffer, and one or more disk IDs that you
--   want to configure as upload buffer.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_AddUploadBuffer.html</a>

--   a cached-volume gateway. This operation is supported only for the
--   gateway-cached volume architecture (see <a>Storage Gateway
--   Concepts</a>).
--   
--   In the request, you specify the gateway Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to
--   which you want to add cache, and one or more disk IDs that you want to
--   configure as cache.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_AddCache.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.AddCache
data AddCache

-- | <a>AddCache</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>acDiskIds</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>Text</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>acGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   </ul>

-- | This operation activates the gateway you previously deployed on your
--   host. For more information, see <a>Activate the AWS Storage
--   Gateway</a>. In the activation process, you specify information such
--   as the region you want to use for storing snapshots, the time zone for
--   scheduled snapshots the gateway snapshot schedule window, an
--   activation key, and a name for your gateway. The activation process
--   also associates your gateway with your account; for more information,
--   see <tt>UpdateGatewayInformation</tt>.
--   
--   You must turn on the gateway VM before you can activate your gateway.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/storagegateway/latest/APIReference/API_ActivateGateway.html</a>
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway.ActivateGateway
data ActivateGateway

-- | <a>ActivateGateway</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>agActivationKey</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agGatewayName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agGatewayRegion</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agGatewayTimezone</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agGatewayType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agMediumChangerType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>agTapeDriveType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
activateGateway :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ActivateGateway

-- | Your gateway activation key. You can obtain the activation key by
--   sending an HTTP GET request with redirects enabled to the gateway IP
--   address (port 80). The redirect URL returned in the response provides
--   you the activation key for your gateway in the query string parameter
--   <tt>activationKey</tt>. It may also include other activation-related
--   parameters, however, these are merely defaults -- the arguments you
--   pass to the <a>ActivateGateway</a> API call determine the actual
--   configuration of your gateway.
agActivationKey :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text
agGatewayName :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | One of the values that indicates the region where you want to store
--   the snapshot backups. The gateway region specified must be the same
--   region as the region in your <tt>Host</tt> header in the request. For
--   more information about available regions and endpoints for AWS Storage
--   Gateway, see <a>Regions andEndpoints</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services
--   Glossary</i>.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: "us-east-1", "us-west-1", "us-west-2",
--   "eu-west-1", "eu-central-1", "ap-northeast-1", "ap-southeast-1",
--   "ap-southeast-2", "sa-east-1"
agGatewayRegion :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | One of the values that indicates the time zone you want to set for the
--   gateway. The time zone is used, for example, for scheduling snapshots
--   and your gateway's maintenance schedule.
agGatewayTimezone :: Lens' ActivateGateway Text

-- | One of the values that defines the type of gateway to activate. The
--   type specified is critical to all later functions of the gateway and
--   cannot be changed after activation. The default value is
--   <tt>STORED</tt>.
agGatewayType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The value that indicates the type of medium changer to use for
--   gateway-VTL. This field is optional.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: <a>STK-L700</a>, <a>AWS-Gateway-VTL</a>
agMediumChangerType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)

-- | The value that indicates the type of tape drive to use for
--   gateway-VTL. This field is optional.
--   
--   <i>Valid Values</i>: <a>IBM-ULT3580-TD5</a>
agTapeDriveType :: Lens' ActivateGateway (Maybe Text)
data ActivateGatewayResponse

-- | <a>ActivateGatewayResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>agrGatewayARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
activateGatewayResponse :: ActivateGatewayResponse
agrGatewayARN :: Lens' ActivateGatewayResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq ActivateGateway
instance Ord ActivateGateway
instance Read ActivateGateway
instance Show ActivateGateway
instance Eq ActivateGatewayResponse
instance Ord ActivateGatewayResponse
instance Read ActivateGatewayResponse
instance Show ActivateGatewayResponse
instance Monoid ActivateGatewayResponse
instance FromJSON ActivateGatewayResponse
instance AWSRequest ActivateGateway
instance ToJSON ActivateGateway
instance ToHeaders ActivateGateway
instance ToQuery ActivateGateway
instance ToPath ActivateGateway


-- | AWS Storage Gateway is a service that connects an on-premises software
--   appliance with cloud-based storage to provide seamless and secure
--   integration between your on-premises IT environment and AWS's storage
--   infrastructure.
module Network.AWS.StorageGateway
